letters of a phrase or name.', 'Blend word: A word created by combining parts of two or more other words.', 'Compound word: A word composed of two or more words joined together, often with no space between them.', 'Palindrome: A word, phrase, or sequence of characters that reads the same backward as forward.', 'Portmanteau: A word created by combining parts of two other words, often with a blend word resulting from their combination.', 'Pun: A play on words, often using multiple meanings or wordplay to create humor or emphasis.', 'Rebus: A picture or symbol used to represent a word or phrase.', 'Semordnilap: A word spelled backwards, but with the letters reversed, so that the first letter becomes the last and vice versa.', 'Spoonerism: An intentional or accidental exchange of two words or sounds in a sentence, often with humorous effect.', 'Squinting phrase: A phrase used to describe something that is difficult to see or understand clearly.', 'Substitution cipher: A method of encoding messages by replacing letters with other letters or symbols, often using a predetermined substitution pattern.', 'Syllable: A unit of sound in a word, often defined as a vowel sound combined with one or more consonant sounds.', 'Theteronym: A word or phrase used to describe the same person or thing from different perspectives or in different contexts.', 'True pseudonym: A fictional name used by an author or artist, often as a pen name or alias.', 'Unary operation: An operation that takes only one operand and produces a single result.', 'Wrap word: A word that wraps around to the beginning of the sentence when read in a particular direction, often creating a palindrome or other wordplay effect.', 'Yoked word: A word or phrase used in conjunction with another word or phrase to create a humorous or ironic effect.', 'Zero-width joiner: A symbol used in writing systems to join two or more characters together without any space or break between them.', 'Zinger: A clever or witty
